2014-06-29.abstract: Subprime mortgages, which gained notoriety as prime cause of 2008 financial crisis, are re-emerging as answer to tight lending standards that have shut out millions of would-be homeowners; new subprime mortgages, which carry higher interest rates than conventional loans, are subject to far greater controls than those issued in early 2000s; shift indicates return of such mortgages to their original function--providing loans to borrowers with poor credit scores at a financial premium.
